Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intraoperative Molecular Imaging in Pulmonary Resection for Lung Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: In this multi-institutional Phase 2 trial, patients with lung nodules were randomised

Participants.evidence: eligibility criteria including patients with suspected lung adenocarcinomas

Intervention.evidence: patients with lung nodules were randomised to receive OTL38 (0.025mg/kg) preoperatively

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of intraoperative molecular imaging (IMI)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the occurrence of clinically significant events (CSE)

Result_Outcome.evidence: IMI improved surgical outcomes in 26% of patients

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events were reported
